# Design Handoff Checklist

Use this checklist to ensure smooth handoffs between UX Designers and Developers.

## Designer Preparation
- [ ] Design files are finalized and accessible (e.g., Figma, Sketch)
- [ ] All design components are documented in the design system
- [ ] Interaction states defined (default, hover, active, disabled, error)
- [ ] Responsive breakpoints and behaviors specified
- [ ] Accessibility requirements documented (WCAG compliance, keyboard navigation)
- [ ] Edge cases and error states designed
- [ ] Design annotations added for complex interactions
- [ ] Assets exported in required formats and resolutions

## Handoff Meeting
- [ ] Walk through user flows and key interactions
- [ ] Review design decisions and rationale
- [ ] Discuss technical constraints or implementation concerns
- [ ] Clarify responsive behavior and breakpoints
- [ ] Review accessibility requirements
- [ ] Identify any design system components that need to be created
- [ ] Agree on implementation timeline and milestones
- [ ] Define acceptance criteria for design quality

## Developer Review
- [ ] Access to design files confirmed
- [ ] Design tokens/variables available (colors, typography, spacing)
- [ ] Component library dependencies identified
- [ ] API requirements for dynamic content understood
- [ ] Technical feasibility confirmed or concerns raised
- [ ] Questions or clarifications documented

## Implementation Check-ins
- [ ] Schedule mid-implementation review
- [ ] Review built components against designs
- [ ] Validate responsive behavior
- [ ] Test accessibility compliance
- [ ] Address any design adjustments needed

## QA Validation
- [ ] Visual QA against design specifications
- [ ] Interaction testing across browsers and devices
- [ ] Accessibility audit completed
- [ ] Edge cases and error states validated
- [ ] UX Designer final approval obtained
